channel.title: Dab on Documentation for Hugo Learn Theme
channel.description: Recent content in Dab on Documentation for Hugo Learn Theme

item.title: Connect to dab db 01 via oracle sql developer
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Connecting to dab-db-01 (173.46.136.5) via Oracle SQL Developer

Revision History:
    2016-04-18 10:42:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)



The gist of this KB is that you’ll need to configure port forwarding 1521 -> 1522.

- ssh into dab-db-01
ssh -L 1522:173.46.136.5:1521 ihasnat@173.46.136.5
- Start SQL Developer and create a connection with the following values for their corresponding field:
Connection Name: dab-db-01 (or your preferred Connection Name)
Username: system
Password: <in 1password>
Hostname: localhost
Port: 1522
- Once the above is added, click Test to test the configuration. You should be good at this point to connect and being querying.```

item.title: Create external user for dab Incomplete
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Apache rewrite rule

Revision History:
    2016-08-23 13:05:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Prerequisites:
- you have a valid request from the DAB Team
— You have access to fda-extldap-01.svcs.hhs.local
- The following information is required:
User’s first and last names
Email address

Steps:
- hopefully Pedro adds steps here (or shares them)

1. ssh into fda-extldap-01.svcs.hhs.local
2. Go to the ldap_admin folder
cd /root/ldap_admin
3. Run the ./Ldap_add_user script to add a user. Answer the prompts according.




=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: dab oracle rds reboot fix
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: DAB Oracle RDS Fix for reboots

Revision History:
    2016-06-15 15:36:00 - Version 1.0 Created by Bao
    2016-06-27 10:36:00 - Version 1.1 - update for stage/dev query

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)


Servers:
- Any Oracle RDS

Background:
Seeing poor performance in the application during certain page loads after reboot. Occurs on the email_log table.

Prerequisites
- Either Toad or SQL developer or any means of connecting to Oracle database is installed.

Solution:
For dev, open Toad or SQL Developer and run this query:
EXEC DBMS_STATS.GATHER_TABLE_STATS ('dab_dev', 'email_log');
EXEC DBMS_STATS.GATHER_TABLE_STATS ('sn_dev', 'email_log');
EXEC DBMS_STATS.GATHER_TABLE_STATS ('modacts_dev', 'email_log');


For Stage:
EXEC DBMS_STATS.GATHER_TABLE_STATS ('dab_test’, 'email_log');
EXEC DBMS_STATS.GATHER_TABLE_STATS ('dab_stage’, 'email_log');



Then check your application.

=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: loading
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Loading Dab Database into Oracle RDS
Revision History:
    2016-05-19 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)




========================================================================================================================================
---- Obtaining the dump - On the Carpathia Server -----
Retrieving the dump from Carpathia
** This step may be omitted if Irfan has provided the dump already
** Usually you can find it in the DEVNAS.
========================================================================================================================================

- ssh into 173.46.136.5
ssh ihasnat@173.46.136.5
- switch to the oracle user.
sudo su - oracle
- run the expdb commands:
- Modacts:
expdp modacts_test/modacts_test DIRECTORY=DATA_PUMP_DIR DUMPFILE=modacts_test.dmp
- Dab:
expdp dab_test/dab_test DIRECTORY=DATA_PUMP_DIR DUMPFILE=dab_test.dmp
- Sharing neutrals:
expdp sn_test/sn_test DIRECTORY=DATA_PUMP_DIR DUMPFILE=sn_test.dmp

- start sqlplus on the Carpathia server:
sqlplus / as sysdba

- Run the following query. The output is the location to where the *.dmp files should be put:
SELECT directory_path FROM dba_directories WHERE directory_name = 'DATA_PUMP_DIR';
- rename all of the dump files. I suggest just using today's date. Example: 
mv modacts_test.dmp modacts_test-05-02.dmp
- SCP the *.dmp files to your local machine
- Start sqlplus and run this command. This is where you will need to move the *.dmp files:
SELECT directory_path FROM dba_directories WHERE directory_name = 'DATA_PUMP_DIR';
- Remember to chown the files to the same owner/group as that directory.



========================================================================================================================================
— Setting up permissions on the AWS RDS ——
========================================================================================================================================
Run these commands in SQL Developer:

grant read, write on directory data_pump_dir to modacts_test;
grant execute on dbms_datapump to modacts_test;

grant read, write on directory data_pump_dir to dab_test;
grant execute on dbms_datapump to dab_test;

grant read, write on directory data_pump_dir to sn_test;
grant execute on data_pump_dir to sn_test;



========================================================================================================================================
---- Vagrant ----
========================================================================================================================================

- Start up the vagrant-ubuntu-oracle-xe VM. The vagrant files can be foud in DEVNAS > Large Files > Oracle Stuff
unzip the zip file
cd vagrant-ubuntu-oracle-xe
vagrant plugin install vagrant-vbguest
vagrant up
vagrant ssh
- copy the *.dmp files to a location that the VM can access.


### Create the public database links. The following 'create public database link' commands only needs to be run once: ###
sqlplus / as sysdba

create public database link to_rds_modacts (LINK NAME PER SCHEMA) connect to modacts_test (USERNAME BY SCHEMA) identified by modacts_test (PASSWORD BY SCHEMA) using '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=dab-dev-1.cxgq5xu6d4zp.us-east-1.rds.amazonaws.com)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SID=DABDEV1)))'; 


create public database link to_rds_dab (LINK NAME PER SCHEMA) connect to dab_test (USERNAME BY SCHEMA) identified by dab_test(PASSWROD BY SCHEMA) using '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=dab-dev-1.cxgq5xu6d4zp.us-east-1.rds.amazonaws.com)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SID=DABDEV1)))';

create public database link to_rds_sn (LINK NAME PER SCHEMA) connect to sn_test (USERNAME BY SCHEMA) identified by sn_test(PASSWORD BY SCHEMA) using '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=dab-dev-1.cxgq5xu6d4zp.us-east-1.rds.amazonaws.com)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SID=DABDEV1)))';

————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————
Sample command:
create public database link to_rds_modacts connect to modacts_dev identified by dR8o.qrPH+Rg8scz7M@+ using '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=dab-dev-1.cxgq5xu6d4zp.us-east-1.rds.amazonaws.com)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SID=DABDEV1)))';
————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————





# If you mess up any public links, you can drop and redo them with the following command:
————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————
Sample command:

drop public database link to_rds_dab;
————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————


BEGIN
  DBMS_FILE_TRANSFER.PUT_FILE(
	source_directory_object   	=> 'DATA_PUMP_DIR',
	source_file_name          	=> 'modacts_test.dmp',--> CHANGE APPROPRIATELY
	destination_directory_object  => 'DATA_PUMP_DIR',
	destination_file_name     	=> 'modacts_test_copied-new.dmp',--> CHANGE APPROPRIATELY
	destination_database      	=> 'to_rds_modacts'--> CHANGE APPROPRIATELY
  );
END;
/

BEGIN
  DBMS_FILE_TRANSFER.PUT_FILE(
	source_directory_object   	=> 'DATA_PUMP_DIR',
	source_file_name          	=> 'dab_test.dmp',--> CHANGE APPROPRIATELY
	destination_directory_object  => 'DATA_PUMP_DIR',
	destination_file_name     	=> 'dab_test_copied-new.dmp',--> CHANGE APPROPRIATELY
	destination_database      	=> 'to_rds_dab'--> CHANGE APPROPRIATELY
  );
END;
/

BEGIN
  DBMS_FILE_TRANSFER.PUT_FILE(
	source_directory_object   	=> 'DATA_PUMP_DIR',
	source_file_name          	=> 'sn_test.dmp', --> CHANGE APPROPRIATELY 
	destination_directory_object  => 'DATA_PUMP_DIR',
	destination_file_name     	=> 'sn_test_copied-new.dmp',--> CHANGE APPROPRIATELY
	destination_database      	=> 'to_rds_sn'--> CHANGE APPROPRIATELY
  );
END;
/

————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————
Sample command:

BEGIN
  DBMS_FILE_TRANSFER.PUT_FILE(
	source_directory_object   	=> 'DATA_PUMP_DIR',
	source_file_name          	=> 'expdp_modacts_2017-06-21.dmp',
	destination_directory_object  => 'DATA_PUMP_DIR',
	destination_file_name     	=> 'expdp_modacts_2017-06-21-copied-new.dmp',
	destination_database      	=> 'to_rds_modacts'
  );
END;
/

BEGIN
  DBMS_FILE_TRANSFER.PUT_FILE(
	source_directory_object   	=> 'DATA_PUMP_DIR',
	source_file_name          	=> 'expdp_dab_2017-06-21.dmp',
	destination_directory_object  => 'DATA_PUMP_DIR',
	destination_file_name     	=> 'expdp_dab_2017-06-21-copied-new.dmp',
	destination_database      	=> 'to_rds_dab'
  );
END;
/

BEGIN
  DBMS_FILE_TRANSFER.PUT_FILE(
	source_directory_object   	=> 'DATA_PUMP_DIR',
	source_file_name          	=> 'expdp_sneutrals_2017-06-21.dmp',
	destination_directory_object  => 'DATA_PUMP_DIR',
	destination_file_name     	=> 'expdp_sneutrals_2017-06-21-copied.dmp',
	destination_database      	=> 'to_rds_sn'
  );
END;
/


————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————




========================================================================================================================================
In SQL Developer
========================================================================================================================================

### RUN THE FOLLOWING SQL IF DOING A SCHEMA RELOAD OR CREATING NEW SCHEMAS ######

create user modacts_dev identified by modacts_dev;
grant connect to modacts_dev;
grant resource to modacts_dev;
grant create view to modacts_dev;
grant read, write on directory data_pump_dir to modacts_dev;
grant execute on dbms_datapump to modacts_dev;
create role modacts_dev_REPORT_ROLE;
create role modacts_dev_USER_ROLE;
create role DISCOVER_REPT_ROLE;
grant CREATE SESSION to modacts_dev_REPORT_ROLE;
grant CREATE SESSION to modacts_dev_USER_ROLE;
grant unlimited tablespace to modacts_dev;



create user dab_dev identified by dab_dev;
grant connect to dab_dev;
grant resource to dab_dev;
grant create view to dab_dev;
grant read, write on directory data_pump_dir to dab_dev;
grant execute on dbms_datapump to dab_dev;
create role dab_dev_ejb_user;
create role dab_dev_user;
create role disc_dab_dev_rept_role;
grant unlimited tablespace to dab_dev;




create user sn_dev identified by sn_dev;
grant connect to sn_dev;
grant resource to sn_dev;
grant create view to sn_dev;
grant read, write on directory data_pump_dir to sn_dev;
grant execute on dbms_datapump to sn_dev;
create role sn_dev_report_ROLE;
create role sn_dev_user;
create role DISCOVER_REPT_ROLE;
grant CREATE SESSION to sn_dev_REPORT_ROLE;
grant CREATE SESSION to sn_dev_USER_ROLE;
grant unlimited tablespace to sn_dev;


————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————
Sample command:
See above for sample commands.

————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————





---- exit SQL Plus, and Load the DB in Vagrant machine using impdp. 
** Run as the oracle user
** Dumps should be found in: /u01/app/oracle/admin/XE/dpdump/

## USE TABLE_EXISTS_ACTION IF ONLY RELOADING TABLE DATA ###
## USE REMAP_SCHEMA OPTIONS IF WE ARE RELOADING DATA FROM DIFFERENT ENVIRONMENT SAY FROM PROD TO STAGE/DEV###

impdp sn_test@DABDEV dumpfile=sn_test_copied-new.dmp DIRECTORY=DATA_PUMP_DIR REMAP_TABLESPACE=system:users REMAP_TABLESPACE=users:users TABLE_EXISTS_ACTION=REPLACE REMAP_SCHEMA=SN:SN_TEST (SOURCE:TARGET)
impdp modacts_dev@DABDEV dumpfile=expdp_modacts_2017-06-21.dmp DIRECTORY=DATA_PUMP_DIR REMAP_TABLESPACE=system:users REMAP_TABLESPACE=users:users TABLE_EXISTS_ACTION=REPLACEREMAP_SCHEMA=MODACTS:MODACTS_TEST (SOURCE:TARGET)
impdp dab_test@DABDEV dumpfile=dab_test_copied-new.dmp DIRECTORY=DATA_PUMP_DIR REMAP_TABLESPACE=system:users REMAP_TABLESPACE=users:users TABLE_EXISTS_ACTION=REPLACE REMAP_SCHEMA=DAB:DAB_TEST (SOURCE:TARGET)


————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————
Sample output:
If you see something similar to the below, you should be fine with the import:


 GRANT "RESOURCE" TO "SN_DEV"
Processing object type SCHEMA_EXPORT/DEFAULT_ROLE
ORA-39083: Object type DEFAULT_ROLE failed to create with error:
ORA-31625: Schema SYSTEM is needed to import this object, but is unaccessible
ORA-01031: insufficient privileges
Failing sql is:
 ALTER USER "SN_DEV" DEFAULT ROLE "CONNECT", "RESOURCE"
Processing object type SCHEMA_EXPORT/PRE_SCHEMA/PROCACT_SCHEMA
Processing object type SCHEMA_EXPORT/SEQUENCE/SEQUENCE
Processing object type SCHEMA_EXPORT/TABLE/TABLE
Processing object type SCHEMA_EXPORT/TABLE/TABLE_DATA
. . imported "SN_DEV"."SN_CASES"                         742.3 KB    3186 rows
. . imported "SN_DEV"."MEDIATORS"                        174.7 KB     403 rows
. . imported "SN_DEV"."MEDIATORS_SN_CASES"               51.28 KB    2216 rows
. . imported "SN_DEV"."SEARCHES"                          66.5 KB    1140 rows
. . imported "SN_DEV"."SN_CASE_UPLOADS"                  94.60 KB     905 rows
. . imported "SN_DEV"."CASETYPES"                        6.468 KB       5 rows
. . imported "SN_DEV"."COMEDIATORS_SN_CASES"             36.43 KB    1251 rows
. . imported "SN_DEV"."MEDIATOR_UPLOADS"                 26.09 KB     185 rows
. . imported "SN_DEV"."OUTCOMES"                         6.906 KB       6 rows
. . imported "SN_DEV"."REPORTS"                          9.781 KB      28 rows
. . imported "SN_DEV"."SCHEMA_MIGRATIONS"                5.289 KB      13 rows
. . imported "SN_DEV"."SN_USERS"                         15.70 KB      21 rows
. . imported "SN_DEV"."STATES"                           7.773 KB      52 rows
. . imported "SN_DEV"."USERS"                            9.484 KB      17 rows
. . imported "SN_DEV"."YEARS"                            6.671 KB      11 rows
Processing object type SCHEMA_EXPORT/TABLE/INDEX/INDEX
Processing object type SCHEMA_EXPORT/TABLE/CONSTRAINT/CONSTRAINT
Processing object type SCHEMA_EXPORT/TABLE/INDEX/STATISTICS/INDEX_STATISTICS
Processing object type SCHEMA_EXPORT/TABLE/STATISTICS/TABLE_STATISTICS
Processing object type SCHEMA_EXPORT/STATISTICS/MARKER
Job "SN_DEV"."SYS_IMPORT_FULL_01" completed with 6 error(s) at Wed Aug 16 15:23:55 2017 elapsed 0 00:00:11
————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————






========================================================================================================================================
Killing sessions for a user (Kudos to Irfan)
** This is different for AWS Oracle RDS. The below will kill sessions and drop a user. 
** Run this in SQL Developer and at the prompt, enter the name of the user you’re trying to drop.
sqlplus sys as sysdba@aws-rds-hostname:1521/ORCL @drop_user_force_aws_rds.sql mytest
https://github.com/juttayaya/oracle/blob/master/drop-user/drop_user_force_aws_rds.sql
http://www.javajirawat.com/2017/07/forcing-oracle-to-drop-user.html
========================================================================================================================================


SET SERVEROUTPUT ON
SET VERIFY OFF
WHENEVER OSERROR CONTINUE;
WHENEVER SQLERROR CONTINUE;

-- Oracle drop user can fail if there are active current connections to the schema
-- This script will destroy all existing connections to the schema, then drop the user
-- This is the AWS RDS version
DECLARE
    v_cnt    INTEGER := 0;
    v_schema VARCHAR2(50);
    v_sid    NUMBER;
    v_serial NUMBER;
BEGIN
    select upper('&1') into v_schema from dual;
    select count(*) into v_cnt from dba_users where username = v_schema;
    IF v_cnt > 0 THEN
        for i in (select * from v$session s where username = v_schema)
        loop
            v_sid := i.sid;
            v_serial := i.serial#;
            -- 'kill session' asks the sessions to kill themselves,
            -- Sometimes session cannot kill themselves, so 'disconnect session' has Oracle force a disconnect.
            -- https://oracle-base.com/articles/misc/killing-oracle-sessions
            dbms_output.put_line('Removing session ''' || v_sid || ',' || v_serial || '''.');
            BEGIN
                rdsadmin.rdsadmin_util.kill(
                  sid    => v_sid,
                  serial => v_serial);
            EXCEPTION
                WHEN OTHERS
                THEN dbms_output.put_line('Error kill session ' || v_sid || ',' || v_serial || ' : ' || SQLERRM);
            END;
            BEGIN
                rdsadmin.rdsadmin_util.disconnect(
                  sid    => v_sid,
                  serial => v_serial);
            EXCEPTION
                WHEN OTHERS
                THEN dbms_output.put_line('Error disconnect session ' || v_sid || ',' || v_serial || ' : ' || SQLERRM);
            END;
        end loop;
        dbms_output.put_line('Dropping user ' || v_schema || '...');
        EXECUTE IMMEDIATE ('drop user ' || v_schema || ' cascade');
        dbms_output.put_line('Done.');
    ELSE
        dbms_output.put_line('The schema ' || v_schema || ' does not exist.');
    END IF;
EXCEPTION
    WHEN OTHERS
    THEN
        dbms_output.put_line(SQLERRM);
END;
/
exit;```
